{{cpp/memory/shared_ptr/title|operator bool}}
{{cpp/memory/shared_ptr/navbar}}
{{ddcl|
explicit operator bool() const noexcept;
}}

Checks if {{c|*this}} stores a non-null pointer, i.e. whether {{c|1=get() != nullptr}}.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
{{c|true}} if {{c|*this}} stores a pointer, {{c|false}} otherwise.

===Notes===
An empty shared_ptr (where {{c|1=use_count() == 0}}) may store a non-null pointer accessible by {{lc|get()}}, e.g. if it were created using the aliasing constructor.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;memory&gt;

void report(std::shared_ptr&lt;int&gt; ptr) 
{
    if (ptr)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "*ptr=" &lt;&lt; *ptr &lt;&lt; "\n";
    else
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "ptr is not a valid pointer.\n";
}

int main()
{
    std::shared_ptr&lt;int&gt; ptr;
    report(ptr);

    ptr = std::make_shared&lt;int&gt;(7);
    report(ptr);
}
|output=
ptr is not a valid pointer.
*ptr=7
}}
